tasks.task: Repairing a disintegrated wheel bearing on a tractor.
subtasks: Identify the problem causing the wheel bearing disintegration.
Clean the axle shaft and bearing holes on both sides.
Remove the old wheel bearing using a hammer and steel bar.
Prepare the new wheel bearing components (hub, race, and dust seal).
Grease the new bearing and install it in the hole, ensuring the widest portion faces outward.
Tap the new bearing into place using a flat object and hammer, checking for even seating.
Grease the inner part of the new seal and install it.
Attach the washer and castellated nut, ensuring the castellated part faces outward.
Tighten the castellated nut, allow rotation, then back off slightly to achieve proper play.
Secure the wheel with a cotter key and bend the end to prevent loosening.

tasks.task: Installing a dust cap on the repaired wheel bearing.
subtasks: Attach the dust cap to the wheel to protect the newly installed seal.
